member.name: T:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.AutoUpdaterDotNET.AutoUpdater
member.summary: Main class that lets you auto update applications by setting some static fields and executing its Start method.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.AutoUpdaterDotNET.AutoUpdater.DownloadPath
member.summary: Set it to folder path where you want to download the update file. If not provided then it defaults to Temp folder.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.AutoUpdaterDotNET.AutoUpdater.InstallationPath
member.summary: If you are using a zip file as an update file then you can set this value to path where your app is installed. This is only necessary when your installation directory differs from your executable path.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.AutoUpdaterDotNET.AutoUpdater.AppTitle
member.summary: Set the Application Title shown in Update dialog. Although AutoUpdater.NET will get it automatically, you can set this property if you like to give custom Title.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.AutoUpdaterDotNET.AutoUpdater.AppCastURL
member.summary: URL of the xml file that contains information about latest version of the application.

member.summary: Login/password/domain for FTP-request

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.AutoUpdaterDotNET.AutoUpdater.OpenDownloadPage
member.summary: Opens the download URL in default browser if true. Very usefull if you have portable application.

member.summary: Set Basic Authentication credentials required to download the file.

member.summary: Set Basic Authentication credentials required to download the XML file.

member.summary: Set the User-Agent string to be used for HTTP web requests.

member.summary: If this is true users can see the skip button.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.AutoUpdaterDotNET.AutoUpdater.ShowRemindLaterButton
member.summary: If this is true users can see the Remind Later button.

member.summary: Set this to true if you want to run update check synchronously.

member.name: M:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.SparkleUpdater.InstallUpdate(Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.AppCastItem,System.String)
member.summary: Run the provided app cast item update regardless of what else is going on. Note that a more up to date download may be taking place, so if you don't want to run a potentially out-of-date installer, don't use this. This should only be used if your user wants to update before another update has been installed AND the file is already downloaded. This function will verify that the file exists and that the DSA signature is valid before running. It will also utilize the PreparingToExit event to ensure that the application can close.
member.param: AppCastItem to install
Install path to the executable. If not provided, will ask the server for the download path.

member.name: M:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.SparkleUpdater.OnWorkerProgressChanged(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This method will be notified by the SparkleUpdater loop when some update info has been downloaded. If the info has been downloaded fully (e.ProgressPercentage == 1), the UI for downloading updates will be shown (if not downloading silently) or the download will be performed (if downloading silently).

member.name: E:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.SparkleUpdater.DownloadFinished
member.summary: Called when the downloaded file is fully downloaded and verified regardless of the value for SilentMode. Note that if you are installing fully silently, this will be called before the install file is executed, so don't manually initiate the file or anything. Useful when using SilentModeTypes.DownloadNoInstall so you can let your user know when the downloaded update is ready.

member.name: E:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.SparkleUpdater.DownloadedFileIsCorrupt
member.summary: Called when the downloaded file is already downloaded (or at least partially on disk) and the DSA signature doesn't match. When this is called, Sparkle is not taking any further action to try to download the install file during this instance of the software. In order to make Sparkle try again, you must delete the file off disk yourself. Sparkle will try again after the software is restarted. This event could allow you to tell the user what happened if updates are silent.

member.name: E:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.SparkleUpdater.CloseApplication
member.summary:
Event for custom shutdown logic. If this is set, it is called instead of Application.Current.Shutdown or Application.Exit. If is set, this has no effect.
Warning: The script that launches your executable only waits for 90 seconds before giving up! Make sure that your software closes within 90 seconds if you implement this event! If you need an event that can be canceled, use .

member.name: E:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.SparkleUpdater.CloseApplicationAsync
member.summary:
Event for asynchronous custom shutdown logic. If this is set, it is called instead of Application.Current.Shutdown or Application.Exit. This overrides .
Warning: The script that launches your executable only waits for 90 seconds before giving up! Make sure that your software closes within 90 seconds if you implement this event! If you need an event that can be canceled, use .

member.name: T:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.RegistryConfiguration
member.summary:
This class handles all registry values which are used from sparkle to handle update intervalls. All values are stored in HKCU\Software\Vendor\AppName which will be read ot from the assembly information. All values are of the REG_SZ type, no matter what their "logical" type is. The following options are available:
CheckForUpdate - Boolean - Whether NetSparkle should check for updates LastCheckTime - time_t - Time of last check SkipThisVersion - String - If the user skipped an update, then the version to ignore is stored here (e.g. "1.4.3") DidRunOnce - Boolean - Check only one time when the app launched

member.name: T:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.SecurityMode
member.summary: Controls the situations where files have to be signed with the DSA private key. If both a DSA public key and a signature are present, they always have to be valid.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.SecurityMode.Unsafe
member.summary: All files (with or without signature) will be accepted. This mode is strongly NOT recommended. It can cause critical security issues.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.SecurityMode.UseIfPossible
member.summary: If there is a DSA public key, the app cast and download file have to be signed. If there isn't a DSA public key, files without a signature will also be accepted. This mode is a mix between Unsafe and Strict and can have some security issues if the DSA public key gets lost in the application.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.SecurityMode.Strict
member.summary: The app cast and download file have to be signed. This means the DSA public key must exist. This is the default mode.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.UserInteractionMode.DownloadAndInstall
member.summary:
Downloads the latest update file and automatically runs it as an installer file.
WARNING: if you don't tell the user that the application is about to quit to update/run an installer, this setting might be quite the shock to the user! Make sure to implement AboutToExitForInstallerRun or AboutToExitForInstallerRunAsync so that you can show your users what is about to happen.

member.summary: Return value of the DSA verification check functions.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.ValidationResult.Valid
member.summary: The DSA public key and signature exists and they are valid.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.ValidationResult.Invalid
member.summary: Depending on the SecurityMode at least one of DSA public key or the signature dosn't exist or they exists but they are not valid. In this case the file will be rejected.

member.name: F:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Software.Updater.NetSparkle.ValidationResult.Unchecked
member.summary: There wasn't any DSA public key or signature and SecurityMode said this is okay.

member.summary: Retrieve the download file name of the app cast item from the server. This is useful if the server has any sort of redirects that take place when starting the download process. member.param: The AppCastItem that will be downloaded
member.returns: The file name of the file to download from the server (including file extension). Null if not found/had error/not applicable.
